sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This is Euronews. Now here are your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Zelensky tells the West to tone down its warnings over the threat of a Russian invasion, worried it's causing panic in his country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: French President Macron holds talks with Russian President Vladimir Putin in an effort to de-escalate the Ukraine crisis as Moscow reiterates that it doesn't want law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: escalate the Ukraine crisis as Moscow reiterates that it doesn't want more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Here in the Cube, we take a closer look at the growing anti-vaccine movement in the United Kingdom and the misinformation they are spreading. And the Australian Open nears its final showdown with Rafael Nadal attempting to win his 21st Grand Slam title, overtaking Federer and Djokovic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: first Grand Slam title, overtaking Federer and Djokovic. I'm Helena Humphrey, glad you could join me.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says that panicked statements about an imminent war with Russia is causing economic harm to his country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Zelenskyy made the comments as he spoke with reporters in Kiev following a call with US President Joe Biden on Thursday. He welcomed US and NATO help but played down reports that Moscow's poised to invade. Zelensky says although Ukraine is not a NATO member it still needs more security guarantees in order to deter a conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I know that some members of NATO don't like us going into these details, but we want to have something specific.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We need to have something that we can count on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: First of all, security guarantees, if we're talking about NATO, and the second is the level of our army.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: No matter when we get into NATO or whether we will be there at all, nothing in this case depends on us. this case depends on us not everything depends on us we have to develop our own army we have to protect ourselves but we understand right now perfectly well that if we are not part of NATO then we are on our own in terms of protecting ourselves well attending

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: that press conference in Kiev was our international correspondent Annelies Borgia she says that although President Zelensky is appealing for calm, he says Russia remains a threat to the whole of Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: If there's one message that we can take out of this presser here in Kiev tonight is that Ukraine does believe Russia poses a threat, not to this nation but to the entire European continent and Ukraine believes that what is at stake right now is not only the stability of this country but the stability of Europe. When I asked Volodymyr Zelenskyy about some of his previous statements the Ukrainian president has been perceived as projecting calm, saying that everything was under control, that there was no reason for panic. This is what the Ukrainian leader had to say. And I mentioned this to President Biden. I think the U.S. supports that. I said that I started talking to the leaders of the countries and to explain to them that we need to stabilize the economy of our country because of those signals which say that tomorrow there will be war, because these signals were sent by even respected leaders of the respected countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Sometimes they are not even using diplomatic language.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They're saying tomorrow is the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This means panic on the market, panic in the financial sector.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: So how much does it cost to our country? The people should trust the government and their special services. We are grateful for any support but this varied information from varied sources cannot mislead our country because this raises economic panic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Vladimir Zelensky there also detailing a phone conversation he had with the U.S. President Joe Biden.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A phone call that reportedly went badly, according to Ukrainian officials.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The call didn't go as planned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Apparently, the two leaders clashed on information that has been dismissed by the White House.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Here in the Ukrainian capital today, the Ukrainian president insisted that he was not here to criticize Joe Biden, that the U.S. doesn't owe Ukraine anything, but that he was in a better position to detail what was really happening in his country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He said that Joe Biden is not a Ukrainian president or a Ukrainian father, a Ukrainian brother, a Ukrainian husband that may worry about his family members in this moment of utmost tension. Well, I caught up with Fyodor Lukyanov who is the chairman of the

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Council on Foreign and Defense Policy that's a Moscow based NGO and he says that President Putin has no interest in Ukraine but it said wants to challenge the West on wider European security issues. You know it's not the aim of anybody here because this strategic, which has been proclaimed very clearly, is not about Ukraine at all.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And this is a serious mismatch between Western debate and Russian debate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In the West, everything is focused and obsessed even with Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In Russia, yes, Ukraine is an important case and a very vital case, but it's just a case in a very big trend about how the European security arrangements will be made in the future. So in this regard...

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: You say it's obsessed, sir, but I think that's because there are 100,000 troops amassed on the border with Ukraine, which of course is raising concerns that Russia is planning an invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Yes, there are concerns that Russia is planning an invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And we hear from the United States that they are sure that Russia is planning an invasion, despite the claims from Kiev that it might be different.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But you should look at this situation a little bit more strategically.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: So Russia said many times what are the issues which Russia would love to discuss with the West.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's not about Ukraine at all. Unfortunately, the West, until recently, was absolutely uninterested to discuss anything from the European security field with Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And all Russian ideas were just ignored, not rejected, just ignored.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And so, unfortunately, since the obsession with Ukraine is so high, this is a mean how to attract your attention.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But isn't this necessarily a risky strategy for Putin, because he risks provoking sanctions, which could be potentially very harmful for Russia?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Yes, indeed. But we know President Putin since very long time. And I think that he is anything Putin since very long time. And I think that he is anything but not a gambler. And all his moves are very well calculated. So I think he takes into account all risks, including, of course, what you mentioned, that that will be very bad for Russia. But he is experienced enough to construct behavior which will allow to avoid it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: to construct behavior which will allow to avoid it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A European watchdog has criticized the office of the EU Commission President for not publishing text messages between Ursula von der Leyen and the CEO of pharma giant Pfizer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: An investigation by the EU ombudsman says that the failure to look for the messages amounted to a lack of transparency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Well, MEPs are calling for a parliamentary investigation, as Shona Murray reports from Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The European Ombudsman has accused the President of the European Commission of maladministration and a lack of transparency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In a recent New York Times interview, President von der Leyen said she exchanged text messages with Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla about the procurement of COVID-19 vaccines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: When those text messages were requested by another journalist as part of Freedom of Information, the Commission failed to publish them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The journalist took the case to the Ombudsman, Emily O'Reilly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Ombudsman has now asked the European Commission to explain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Commission rules do not say that you have to keep this or that type of means of communication.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Commission rules do not say that you have to keep this or that type of means of communication. They say that you have to save documents when it is something of a substantial nature linked to the policies of the European Commission. But it does not necessarily mean that every SMS, WhatsApp, etc., that is sent must be kept.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Ombudsman inquiry revealed that the Commission didn't ask the President's personal office to look for the text messages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Dutch MEP Sophie Entefeld says the Commission's position is simply not in line with the spirit or letter of transparency legislation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: You don't have to be a lawyer to see that it's simply an inaccurate interpretation, that it's simply not in line with the law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But what I find even more shocking and worrying is the complete absence of any kind of reaction from the European Parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Because this should not be an issue for a single MEP or an activist or a journalist.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This is an institutional issue. This is about the treaty obligation, the democratic obligation to transparency, to be transparent to citizens, to be accountable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The spokesperson for President von der Leyen says the commission will respond in due time before the end of April. Shona Murray, Euronews, Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Now in the UK, anti-vaccine sentiment is growing and there's been increased attempts to shut down

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: centres offering Covid jabs. Many of those responsible are spreading false information and referring to ancient defunct English laws.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Matthew in the Cube has been taking a look.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Health officials around the world have been reiterating that Covid-19 vaccines are safe and effective and that any risks are extremely rare.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But despite this, here in Europe, we are still seeing weekly protests by anti-vaccine voices. And in the United Kingdom, these protests have taken on a very different format. A number of videos circulating online this week have shown citizens approaching hospitals, vaccine centres and even police stations. Here they display fake legal documents giving them to both health workers and to police officers, saying that they are trying to shut down vaccine centres and, in their words, bring politicians to justice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Now, these fake legal documents contain a variety of unsubstantiated claims, including allegations that during the pandemic the UK government has been committing murder and war crimes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Now, some of the people sharing these kind of letters call themselves sovereign citizens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This is a movement that was founded in the United States in the 1970s.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And these people believe that they have the so-called common law power to bring politicians and civil servants to justice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: to bring politicians and civil servants to justice. But it's important to stress that this group cites a number of old defunct laws that in 2022 have no legal basis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But they're not alone. There are other examples of misinformation that are continuing to spread.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: For example, here you have a number of people online who make allegations that the United Kingdom, London Metropolitan Police have launched a world leading criminal investigation into COVID-19 vaccines. Here they cite a supposed police case number. But these claims are false. The Metropolitan Police have released a statement saying that that case number is routinely generated whenever anybody makes a complaint.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They say in a statement it does not mean that any crime has been committed, nor that any investigation has been launched.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And what's more, police have also said that anyone sovereign citizen or anti vaccine protester who tries to harass any medical workers will be dealt with.
